REQ-001.text: Prompts declare dependencies via depends-on in frontmatter

REQ-002.text: Engine performs topological sort to determine execution order

REQ-003.text: Within a phase, prompts with satisfied dependencies appear in profile-defined order

REQ-004.text: Circular dependencies detected at pipeline resolution time

REQ-005.text: Circular dependency error reports full cycle path

REQ-006.text: Missing dependency in profile reports error message

REQ-007.text: Dependencies are always on prompt names (strings), not artifact files

REQ-008.text: extra-prompts/add-prompts referencing non-existent prompt is a resolution error

REQ-009.text: Topological sort uses Kahn's algorithm with profile-defined order as tiebreaker

REQ-010.text: After sorting, verification step confirms every prompt appears after all its dependencies

REQ-011.text: Resolution happens once at init time and is cached in config.json

REQ-012.text: Resolution re-runs when the profile or prompt list changes

REQ-013.text: config.json records completed, pending, and pipeline metadata

REQ-014.text: Completion recorded by adding prompt name to completed array with timestamp

REQ-015.text: Primary completion detection: resume checks if produces artifacts exist on disk

REQ-016.text: Secondary completion detection: resume records completion to completed array

REQ-017.text: When artifact exists but not in completed array, artifact takes precedence

REQ-018.text: When completed says done but artifacts missing, resume warns and suggests re-run

REQ-019.text: Re-running completed prompt replaces previous completion entry (not duplicate)

REQ-020.text: config.json format matches specified JSON structure

REQ-021.text: Shared context object in .scaffold/context.json accumulates data

REQ-023.text: Context is append-only; prompt can overwrite own namespace but not another's

REQ-024.text: Context values are JSON — no binary

REQ-025.text: If context.json doesn't exist when read, prompt sees empty object

REQ-026.text: If F-PE-3 deferred, all references removed and prompts read predecessor files directly

REQ-027.text: Scaffold loads prompt content resolved via 3-tier precedence

REQ-028.text: $ARGUMENTS substituted; replaced with empty string if no arguments

REQ-029.text: Prompts execute one at a time, sequentially

REQ-030.text: Pre-execution preview shows which files will be created/updated from produces field

REQ-031.text: After prompt completes, shows 'Prompt X complete. Next: Y. Run it now?'

REQ-032.text: Failed prompt (user aborts, Claude errors) is NOT marked complete

REQ-033.text: Scaffold does not modify prompt content beyond $ARGUMENTS substitution

REQ-034.text: Before prompt executes, verify predecessor produces artifacts exist on disk

REQ-035.text: Missing artifact shows warning with 3 options

REQ-036.text: Run predecessor first executes the missing prompt then returns

REQ-037.text: Proceed anyway continues without the missing artifact

REQ-038.text: If predecessor was skipped, its artifacts are not required

REQ-039.text: Verification runs before $ARGUMENTS substitution and prompt loading

REQ-041.text: Decision log format: array of prompt/decision/at objects

REQ-042.text: Decision log entries never modified or deleted (append-only)

REQ-043.text: Created by init as empty array

REQ-044.text: Each prompt optionally records 1-3 key decisions after execution

REQ-045.text: Decision log committed to git alongside .scaffold/ files

REQ-049.text: mobile profile includes 18 prompts with add-maestro

REQ-050.text: api-service profile includes same 16 prompts as cli-tool

REQ-053.text: Users can create profiles in .scaffold/profiles/ or ~/.scaffold/profiles/

REQ-054.text: Custom profile format: name, extends, description, add-prompts, remove-prompts, prompt-overrides

REQ-055.text: If extends omitted, profile must include full prompts array

REQ-056.text: add-prompts and remove-prompts applied after inheriting: adds first, then removes

REQ-057.text: Array order in prompts and add-prompts preserved as tiebreaker

REQ-058.text: prompt-overrides maps prompt names to file paths; paths resolve relative to project root

REQ-059.text: Custom profiles appear alongside built-in profiles during init

REQ-060.text: Project-level profiles take precedence over user-level with same name

REQ-062.text: Resolution order: base prompts → add → remove → overrides per level

REQ-063.text: Removing a prompt that an added prompt depends on surfaces conflict

REQ-065.text: Prompts are Markdown files with optional YAML frontmatter

REQ-066.text: Frontmatter fields: description, depends-on, phase, argument-hint, produces, reads

REQ-067.text: depends-on defaults to empty array if omitted

REQ-068.text: phase defaults to phase of last dependency, or 1 if no dependencies

REQ-069.text: produces required for built-in prompts, optional for custom

REQ-070.text: reads optional; used by skill to pre-load predecessor documents

REQ-071.text: All v1 prompts will have frontmatter added/updated

REQ-072.text: Specific dependency graph declared in PRD

REQ-074.text: If no arguments, $ARGUMENTS replaced with empty string

REQ-076.text: Profile override pointing to non-existent file is resolution error

REQ-077.text: Scaffold logs which source was used when executing a prompt

REQ-078.text: Custom prompt with no frontmatter inherits metadata from built-in

REQ-079.text: New custom prompt with no frontmatter: no dependencies, Phase 1

REQ-080.text: Custom prompts identified by filename, lowercase, hyphenated

REQ-081.text: Custom prompt appears at position determined by phase and depends-on

REQ-082.text: Custom prompts can depend on built-in; built-in never depend on custom

REQ-083.text: Simply placing a file in .scaffold/prompts/ does NOT auto-include it

REQ-086.text: If idea provided, stored and passed as $ARGUMENTS to create-prd

REQ-088.text: If config.json exists, warns and stops unless --force

REQ-089.text: After profile selection and pipeline display, asks user to confirm

REQ-090.text: init is NOT a prompt in the pipeline

REQ-091.text: Profile discovery: built-in → project → user; project takes precedence for same name

REQ-093.text: Custom option walks through per-phase prompt selection with multiSelect

REQ-094.text: Phases with >4 prompts split across multiple questions (groups of ≤4)

REQ-095.text: Zero prompts selected shows minimal pipeline message

REQ-096.text: User cancels during profile selection → no files written

REQ-097.text: --force deletes config.json, context.json, decisions.json but preserves prompts/ and profiles/

REQ-098.text: --force shows what will be reset and requires user confirmation

REQ-099.text: resume reads config.json to determine next uncompleted prompt

REQ-101.text: Supports --from <prompt-name> to restart from specific prompt

REQ-102.text: If all prompts complete, suggests next actions

REQ-103.text: If config.json doesn't exist, shows No pipeline found message

REQ-104.text: /scaffold:init --dry-run resolves and displays pipeline without executing

REQ-105.text: Shows full resolved pipeline: names, phases, deps, source tier, artifacts

REQ-107.text: Does not create .scaffold/ directory or any files

REQ-108.text: Can be run outside a project directory to preview built-in profiles

REQ-109.text: After prompt completes or resume runs, shows completed/total, current phase, next prompt

REQ-110.text: Completed prompts show ✓, next prompt shows →, pending prompts indented

REQ-111.text: Progress displayed after each prompt completes and when resume invoked

REQ-112.text: /scaffold:status displays progress without offering to run next prompt

REQ-113.text: status: If config.json doesn't exist, shows No pipeline found

REQ-114.text: status: If all complete, shows Pipeline complete (18/18)

REQ-116.text: /scaffold:skip records prompt as skipped in config.json

REQ-117.text: Skipped format includes prompt, at, reason in skipped array

REQ-119.text: Skipped prompts treated as done for dependency resolution

REQ-123.text: When idea text provided, Claude analyzes and recommends profile

REQ-124.text: Recommended profile appears first with (Recommended) appended

REQ-127.text: File-based signals: package.json deps, Expo config, bin/ directory

REQ-128.text: File-based signals override keyword signals when they conflict

REQ-129.text: If no clear signal, default to no recommendation

REQ-130.text: Validates profiles and prompt files for errors without modifying files

REQ-132.text: If no errors: All profiles and prompts are valid

REQ-133.text: Errors grouped by source file with actionable messages

REQ-137.text: Shows what will be deleted/preserved, requires confirmation

REQ-138.text: If config.json doesn't exist: No pipeline state to reset.

REQ-139.text: Brownfield detection: package manifest with ≥1 dep, or src/lib/ with ≥1 source

REQ-140.text: Offers brownfield vs greenfield choice when detection triggers

REQ-142.text: Config.json includes mode: brownfield or greenfield

REQ-144.text: Brownfield create-prd reads existing code to draft PRD

REQ-145.text: Brownfield tech-stack reads package manifests and presents detected stack

REQ-147.text: Brownfield dev-env-setup documents existing dev commands

REQ-148.text: Brownfield implemented as conditional sections, not separate files

REQ-149.text: Prompts detect brownfield by reading config.json mode field

REQ-150.text: /scaffold:next shows next eligible prompt with name, description, produces, reads

REQ-152.text: If all complete: Pipeline complete. All prompts have been executed.

REQ-153.text: If no config: No pipeline found message

REQ-154.text: Does not modify state or offer to execute

REQ-155.text: /scaffold:adopt scans for package manifests, docs/, README, test/CI configs

REQ-156.text: Maps findings to Scaffold prompts and marks them complete

REQ-158.text: Shows what was detected, requires user confirmation

REQ-159.text: Detects v1 project by presence of artifacts without .scaffold/

REQ-160.text: Artifact-to-prompt mapping uses produces field from frontmatter

REQ-161.text: Never modifies existing v1 artifacts during detection

REQ-162.text: Shows what was detected and asks user to confirm

REQ-163.text: After detection, pipeline continues with uncompleted prompts

REQ-164.text: No dedicated migration prompts — universal update mode handles v1
REQ-164.note: Won't-have negative requirement — no story needed

REQ-165.text: Standalone commands accessible at any time

REQ-166.text: Standalone commands do not appear in pipeline preview or progress

REQ-167.text: Standalone commands do not require config.json (except resume)

REQ-168.text: prompt-pipeline shows resolved pipeline from config.json if exists, else built-in

REQ-170.text: Opt-in prompts addable via add-prompts or extra-prompts

REQ-171.text: Resolved pipeline displayed as numbered, phase-grouped list before confirm

REQ-172.text: Corrupt config.json → fallback to artifact-based detection

REQ-173.text: User-modified config.json → validate extra-prompts and re-resolve deps

REQ-174.text: Newer scaffold-version in config → warn but continue operating

REQ-175.text: Resume all complete: show completion summary with artifacts, decisions, time, next steps

REQ-176.text: Custom prompt file follows same format as built-in

REQ-177.text: Invalid frontmatter shows clear error with field name and valid values

REQ-178.text: Scaffold does not validate prompt content — trusts user's customization

REQ-179.text: Profile appears in init selection alongside built-in profiles

REQ-180.text: v1 detection: ambiguous profile → present candidates via AskUserQuestion

REQ-181.text: v1 detection: partial project → only mark complete where ALL produces exist

REQ-182.text: Config versioning: unknown fields preserved on read/write

REQ-183.text: If scaffold-version newer than running version, warn but don't refuse

REQ-185.text: All pipeline logic expressed as natural-language in prompt files

REQ-186.text: Instructions must be precise with verification steps

REQ-187.text: Plugin manifest updated with new version and description

REQ-188.text: Auto-activated skill updated to reference v2 pipeline from config.json

REQ-189.text: Skill falls back to showing profiles if no config exists

REQ-190.text: Optional reads field: skill ensures Claude has read listed files

REQ-191.text: Missing file in reads is skipped silently

REQ-192.text: Pipeline resolution for up to 50 prompts in under 1 second

REQ-193.text: Prompt loading from any tier in under 100ms

REQ-195.text: No background processes, daemons, or watchers

REQ-196.text: Crash recovery: prompt not marked complete, user can resume

REQ-197.text: Config integrity: incomplete config.json → resume detects and recovers

REQ-198.text: Idempotent prompts: running twice does not produce corrupt state

REQ-199.text: Requires Claude Code with plugin support

REQ-200.text: macOS and Linux supported; Windows via WSL expected to work

REQ-201.text: No Node.js dependency for Scaffold itself

REQ-203.text: Config files versioned with scaffold-version field

REQ-204.text: Plugin remains small with no external runtime dependencies

REQ-205.note: Negative requirement — security constraint implicit in all stories

REQ-206.text: No network access by Scaffold's engine

REQ-207.note: Negative requirement — no elevated permissions needed

REQ-208.text: No automatic prompt execution without user confirmation

REQ-209.text: No prompt versioning or rollback within Scaffold

REQ-210.text: No remote profile registry or marketplace

REQ-211.text: No GUI or web interface — CLI-only

REQ-212.text: No support for non-Claude Code environments

REQ-213.text: No runtime prompt generation — prompts are static Markdown

REQ-214.text: No prompt marketplace for third-party prompts

REQ-215.note: Won't-have — out of scope, US-2.5 states sequential

REQ-216.text: No breaking changes to prompt content in v2

REQ-219.text: multiSelect: true allows selecting multiple from same 2-4 limit

REQ-220.text: Interrupted AskUserQuestion results in no state change

REQ-221.text: Selections with >4 items split across multiple sequential questions
